benchmark_details.name: NLPCONTRIBUTION GRAPH (NCG)
benchmark_details.overview: NLPCONTRIBUTION GRAPH is a novel scheme to annotate research contributions from NLP articles and integrate them in a knowledge graph, facilitating fine-grained semantic knowledge capture over precise information targets modeled as nodes and links.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a structured knowledge graph of contributions in Natural Language Processing scholarly articles.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: NLPCONTRIBUTION GRAPH has limited scope for structuring scholarly contributions compared to STEM scholarly knowledge at large.

data.source: 50 NLP scholarly articles randomly selected across five different NLP subfields.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by a single annotator.

methodology.calculation: Intra-annotation agreement metrics calculated between pilot and adjudicated annotations.
methodology.interpretation: F1-scores of 67.92% for sentences, 41.82% for phrases, and 22.31% for triples indicating varying degrees of annotation agreement.
methodology.validation: Data validated through pilot and adjudication stages with specific annotation guidelines.
